At the beginning of Heaven and Earth, there was the Nameless—
I grasped the primal before Heaven and Earth.
With names, it became the Mother of the Myriad Things,
And the myriad things return to the vast origin.

Gathering yin to form the Earth,
Accumulating yang to shape the Heavens—
Stealing the principle of the Three Powers,
Cinnabar aligns with Nature.

The true and upright virtue of Qian and Kun,
Radiant and bright, gives birth to the essence of life.
Dim and distant, then dark and profound,
Its reflected light embraces the Great One.

Gold takes cinnabar as its master,
Receiving harmony from the mother of mercury.
The essence of the sun’s departing fire,
Pierces the abode of the formless and unseen.
Spiritual brilliance penetrates the luminous,
Its radiant splendor blazing forth and abiding.

The White Tiger inhales the red glass,
Golden blossoms give rise to jade mushrooms.
To congeal the supreme medicine,
Myriad transformations follow the hexagrams’ strategies.

The cinnabar’s image follows the hexagrams’ grains,
Its numinous efficacy defies depiction.
The treasure coalesces in azure skies,
Its rosy glow dividing into five hues:
First called Crimson Golden Red,
Second named Flying White Snow,
Third termed Celestial Valley Green,
Fourth known as Black Lead Liquid,
Fifth named Central Yellow Essence—
Once solidified, it endures for ten thousand springs.

Searching the hundred bones and nine orifices,
All illness is eradicated.
It restores the aged and infirm,
Lightens the body, and darkens the hair.
Teeth regrow like silver and jade,
Dim eyes shine like lamps.
Concealing one’s traces among men,
One accumulates deeds of hidden virtue.

Not clinging to worldly splendor,
One may yet ascend to the Jade Clarity.
Heal the sick when they seek aid,
Bestow gold upon the poor,
Impart the alchemical canon to the earnest—
Thus concludes the first scroll of *Master Xu’s Stone Casket Record*.

**Oral Instructions of Master Chen**
When merit and practice reach fulfillment in a single morning,
Heavenly scriptures arrive at the Supreme Ultimate.

True medicine is lead,
True mercury follows the fire’s arising.
Water and fire respond to Heaven’s tally,
Timing must not err.
If the four seasons fall out of balance,
Cold and warmth no longer follow the rhythm.
Midwinter like scorching summer,
Midsummer thick with frost and snow—
Often the clepsydra falters,
Dawn and dusk grow indistinct.

When Kun’s fire wanes toward extinction,
Yin’s encroachment stirs yet unmanifest.
Water surges, Kan consumes yang,
Fire multiplies, poised to fell the wood.
Mutual conquest, not mutual generation,
Yin and yang defy the proper order.
Fire and metal fail to return,
The Dipper strays south and north.
The four sevens plunge into chaos,
The celestial pivot is lost.

Refining adepts, ponder deeply,
Apply your mind with meticulous care.
Knowing it need not be spoken,
It lies in diligent practice.
Read this text ten thousand times—
It is called the Ladder to Heaven.

Thus concludes the second scroll of *Master Xu’s Stone Casket Record*.

**The Sage Stone’s Pointer to the Mysterious**
From what constraint do the myriad forms arise in emptiness?
Wondrous transformation stems from cinnabar and mercury.

From Fusang’s east, the golden crow’s essence emerges,
Its flaming feathers ablaze with radiance.
Soaring and coursing, the yang fire is called the Sun’s Soul,
Setting at dusk, flourishing at dawn—waning returns to waxing.
The red wheel harnesses the chariot of dawn’s light,
Circling the lost and returning, roaming the bounded realm.
The true essence manifests as cinnabar through the body,
Melting stone and flowing gold—who can discern its depth?

Its light sustains Heaven and Earth, receiving the sun’s glow,
All things live through the cinnabar’s transformation.
Yet cinnabar is no fabricated thing,
Not smelted from the five metals nor the eight stones.
Within the Great Void lies the grain of Returned Cinnabar,
Transforming into a night-shining pearl unknown to men.
The pearl’s glow, dense and resplendent, appears in the cinnabar skies,
The jade hare’s limpid radiance follows the hexagrams’ lines.
Kun gives rise to Zhen, Dui to Qian, then Xun,
Gen and Kun begin and end, returning to the yang lines.
Yang departs, yin arrives—the sacred medicine,
Immortal perfected ones call it Purple Golden Ointment.

One drop restores sight to the blind,
Two drops regrow flesh on withered bones,
Three drops transmute stubborn stone into gold,
Four drops turn long rivers to curds,
Five drops keep spring blossoms from falling,
Sun and moon bloom eternally, never fading.
Common pottery and rubble all turn to gold,
Decayed things touched by it renew their hue.
For those afflicted by consumptive corpse-transmission,
Ingesting it brings instant efficacy and bodily lightness.

The foolish claim it is a thing within the body,
Seeking matches in the bedchamber.
Yet it is not the body’s qi and essence—
When essence departs and qi dissipates, what enters?
The hundred spirits scatter and flee,
Leaving the aged, withered, and infirm with chronic ailments.
The sage declares all such notions false—
How can they compare to refining the golden liquid?

The master explains the golden liquid’s ancient origin:
At Pan Gu’s initial division, the Dao’s root.
It was the dragon’s essence giving birth to the tiger’s marrow,
Jia and Yi, Geng and Xin transforming into Ren and Gui.
Bing and Ding, the Vermilion Bird’s fiery spirit soars,
Descending to the Dark Heaven to unite with Wu and Ji.
Thirty-six cycles of ascent and descent,
Scarlet intertwining in north and south.
Subtly inverting the essence of Heaven and Earth,
Wondrous creation arises from the Three, the Five, and the One.

What do the Three, the Five, and the One signify?
They give birth to Heaven, Earth, and Man.
Birth to Heaven grants the power to reverse Heaven,
Birth to Earth ensures firmness and the flourishing of all things.
Birth to Man divides high and low—
Those of shallow fortune cannot refine cinnabar.
The earnest adept must first recognize lead,
For without discerning true lead, cultivation is in vain.

Heaven has five thieves—those who see them prosper.
Lead harbors five hues, each an auspicious sign.
Born from the Nameless at Heaven and Earth’s beginning,
The Mother of the Myriad Things is no ordinary being.
Beyond the ordinary, it eludes even sages,
Hidden within the Mysterious Origin’s indistinct depths.
Dim and distant, dark and profound—awaiting the utmost essence,
Stirring yang into lightning, generating light.

The light spirals, dividing into five colors,
Beneath it lies lead’s essence, unknown to men.
In spring, plants and trees; in summer, like ice;
In autumn, no gathering frost; in winter, no snow.
Embracing harmony, nurturing gradually to numinous attainment,
The yellow sprout does not mingle with worldly lead.

The yellow sprout, nurtured for eight hundred years,
Transforms into azure mercury, elusive to find.
Azure mercury, quicksilver hard to seek,
It courses through the Four Great without end.
Azure mercury, aged another eight hundred years,
Transforms into azure gold, even harder to obtain.
Azure gold is the azure dragon’s bone,
Its generating number three, its completing number eight.
When three and eight’s count ends, mercury’s qi turns azure,
Transforming into azure dust that ascends.

Ascending forever as the immortal’s emolument,
Through eons of primal brightness, it becomes the Five Blessings.
Emerald clouds and luminous azure dust,
Rising to the Clear Capital, returning to its domain.
Entering the Palace of Purple Yang,
The Hall of Bright Sun blazes with dragon’s red glow.
Its radiance shines boundlessly,
Utmost yang extinguishes all yin’s shadows.

Lead divides into five hues, flames soaring into the void—
Azure, crimson, white, black, with yellow at the center.

chunks.original_text: 荧荧皎皎色融融，紫神瑞气丹霞笼。 万神呼吸铅气通，玉童玉女啖太空， 准食其辉天老翁，群仙饮食寿无穷。 先朝玉帝现玄穹，说是还丹药祖宗， 此铅不与世铅同，悬空晃朗朗悬空，落霞光透水晶宫，隐明内昭金鸡容。 呼吸风云会虎龙，龙呼於虎虎呼龙，浩气结成真至药，人准迅速入云中。 改形换骨身飞空，貌同元始天尊容，共分一气天地同，返本还源是祖宗。 说尽万般差别法，总与金砂事不同，住世铅精五金主，七十二石之父母。 炼士英灵采得来，倾下先须去阴土，铅砂搏成如土块，六一固济相爱护， 用火缎炼一昼夜，火灭姻消土化灰。 腾铅倒制入灰池，火发铅镕化神水， 神水元因出白金，先取白金为鼎器，白金即是水银胎，返本还源水银制， 水银便是长生药，不是凡问水银作。 朱雀炎空飞下来，摧折羽毛头与脚， 水银绿此不能飞，炼作金丹为大药。 更言恐怕泄天机，此言闻者世间稀， 不是叮咛频嘱付，好色贪财如兽畜。 如违戒约有神明，摄入邓都罪不轻， 更有九泉无限苦，不可等闲容易语。 等闲容易泄非人，万劫沉沦受冥苦。 神室圆明论 凡世间万事，有一事之非凡，非凡者，乃真一之事也，述还丹之道也。 学者甚多，皆不见根源，难穷本末，所以千举万败，竟无成。 果世稀遇者哉！ 凡修大丹，要在筑坛旺方，取土地，择吉祥，不得妄为，妄为招殃。 坛有三级兮方八尺，上下不等兮各有绳墨。 上有一层高二六，上按九官兮九曜九位上方阔一丈六兮二八之数，中有一层高二五，中分八卦兮坛中之心腹，中方阔上丈四兮按二十四气，下有一层高二六，下列八门兮开闭有度，下方阔二丈八兮按二十八宿，四面创剑兮镇压四方，八面悬镜兮照灭邪殃，挂五色彩兮依位逐方，坛上有鳌兮名曰神炉，神炉出没兮炉收火气，收火气兮而聚鼎，鼎受火气兮养神室，神室圆明兮非圆非明，非圆兮状如鹦子，非明兮逐月而生。 金鼎偃月如锅釜，神室为子两分尖，入鼎定鼎鼎难定，入鼎横胎倒鼎偏，倒鼎明堂失正德，横胎用定乱阴阳。 日月不交金水竭。 情性相离不相接，男冠女笄失时年，气不交兮体不合，只因法象有偏颇，致使乾坤不交接。 坎离南北乱纵横，束西卯酉难分别，水火失位，金木差方。 龙潜变匿，失天际之归舟，杀气随风耗散，则虎无形者，盖谓金胎失产，鸡兔相离，覆载无端，倾失神水。 若欲求乌，获兔，须凭匠手立乾坤，入鼎讽燮，重整阴阳运日月，始得依方逐位，金木交并。 运火气而生日晶，伏金水而滋月魄，束西南北之气，并降归金鼎之中，虎瑞龙祥咸结於杳冥之内。 混沌交光，辉辉寥廓，寥廓真空，真空炼妙，炼妙真空，真空隐奥。 隐空炼妙炼庚金，妙分少女，兑体生壬，此言炼妙成神室，神室明开神出没，出为明，此言炼妙合为灵，灵质玲珑神为气，气无质，气入杳冥通恍惚，恍惚中居中有灵，灵言妙气合为神，神运气，气生灵，灵为子，气为母，玄元圣祖岂虚言。 又言炼神合於道，炼神合道非常道，宜向阴符细寻讨观天之道天若何，天有银河室有何，室有星河布列宿，张翼飞兮虚危逐，二十八宿运推兮，水火交踱在南北，赀参相命合氏房，白虎青龙在两傍，虎啸风生龙吐雾，雾霞红红胜火乱。

Glowing bright and radiant, hues blend in warmth,
Purple spirits and auspicious qi shroud in cinnabar clouds.
The myriad spirits breathe, lead’s qi flows through,
Jade lads and jade maidens feast upon the vast sky,
Feeding on its radiance, the Heavenly Elder,
All immortals partake, their lives boundless.

Once the Jade Emperor appeared in the dark vault,
Proclaiming this the ancestral lineage of returning elixir.
This lead differs from worldly lead—
Suspended in space, luminous and resplendent,
Its sunset glow pierces the Crystal Palace,
Concealed brilliance reveals the Golden Rooster’s form.

Breathing winds and clouds, tiger and dragon convene,
Dragon calls to tiger, tiger calls to dragon,
Vast qi congeals into the true supreme medicine,
Swift as lightning, one ascends into the clouds.
Transforming form and bone, the body soars through space,
Its visage like the Primordial Heavenly Honored One,
Sharing one qi with heaven and earth,
Returning to the root, reverting to the source—this is the ancestor.

Though myriad divergent methods are expounded,
None compare to the affairs of golden cinnabar.
Abiding in the world, lead essence rules the five metals,
Parent of the seventy-two stones.
When the adept’s spirit gathers it,
First cast out the yin earth.
Knead lead and cinnabar into clods of soil,
Sealed with the six-one method, cherished and guarded.
Refine with fire for a day and night,
Fire extinguished, smoke dispersed, earth turns to ash.
Rising lead inverts and enters the ash pool,
Fire ignites, lead melts into divine water.
This divine water originally issues from white gold—
First take white gold to fashion the crucible,
White gold is the womb of mercury,
Reverting to the source, mercury is refined.
Mercury is the elixir of immortality,
Not the common mercury of the vulgar world.

Azure Phoenix descends from the flaming sky,
Shedding feathers, head, and talons.
Mercury, thus subdued, cannot take flight,
Refined into golden elixir, the great medicine.

Yet I fear revealing heaven’s secrets,
Such words are rare in the mortal realm.
If not for repeated exhortations,
Those lustful and greedy would be no better than beasts.
Should one violate these precepts, the gods know—
Drawn into Dengdu, the punishment is no light matter.
Beyond lie the nine springs, endless suffering,
Not to be spoken of lightly or carelessly.
Careless speech betrays the unworthy,
Dooming them to ten thousand kalpas of hellish torment.

**On the Luminous Perfection of the Spirit Chamber**

Among all worldly affairs, only one is extraordinary—
That extraordinary thing is the matter of the True One,
The Way of the Returning Elixir.
Many scholars pursue it,
Yet few glimpse its root or fathom its end,
Thus a thousand attempts yield ten thousand failures,
And true success remains rare.

For the great elixir’s refinement,
One must build an altar in an auspicious direction,
Select the land, choose an auspicious day—
No reckless action, lest misfortune be invited.
The altar has three tiers, each eight feet square,
Unequal in height, each with its own guiding line.
The topmost tier stands two by six in height,
Aligned with the Nine Palaces, the nine luminaries, nine positions—
Its upper breadth one zhang and six feet, the number of two eights.
The middle tier stands two by five in height,
Divided by the Eight Trigrams, the heart and viscera of the altar—
Its breadth one zhang and four feet, corresponding to the twenty-four qi.
The lowest tier stands two by six in height,
Arranged with the eight gates, opening and closing by measure—
Its breadth two zhang and eight feet, aligned with the twenty-eight constellations.
Four sides wield swords to suppress the four directions,
Eight mirrors hang to dispel inauspicious influences,
Five-colored silks drape according to position and direction.
Upon the altar rests a sacred furnace named the Spirit Crucible,
The Spirit Crucible appears and vanishes, gathering fire’s qi,
Gathering fire’s qi to nurture the cauldron,
The cauldron receives fire’s qi to nourish the Spirit Chamber.
The Spirit Chamber, luminous and perfect—
Not round, yet like a parrot’s form,
Not bright, yet waxing with the moon.

The golden cauldron, crescent like a pot,
The Spirit Chamber, its child, tapers at both ends.
Entering the cauldron, the cauldron resists settling,
Entering the cauldron, the embryo lies transverse, the cauldron tilts.
An inverted cauldron loses the Hall of Brightness’ true virtue,
A transverse embryo disrupts yin and yang.
Sun and moon fail to unite, metal and water exhaust,
Passion and nature part, never to meet.
Man’s cap and woman’s hairpin miss their timely years,
Qi fails to merge, bodies fail to unite—
All because the ritual image is askew,
Causing Qian and Kun to remain unjoined.
Kan and Li, north and south, in chaos,
East and west, Mao and You, indistinguishable.
Water and fire lose their positions,
Metal and wood stray from their directions.
The dragon hides, vanishing from the celestial path,
Killing qi scatters with the wind—
The tiger, formless, for the golden embryo fails to take shape.
Hare and rooster part, heaven and earth overturn without reason,
Divine water spills and is lost.

If one seeks the crow and obtains the hare,
One must rely on the craftsman’s hand to establish Qian and Kun,
Enter the cauldron to harmonize, reorder yin and yang,
Revolve the sun and moon—
Only then can one follow positions and directions,
Metal and wood unite.
Revolving fire’s qi to engender the solar essence,
Subduing metal and water to nourish the lunar spirit.
The qi of east, west, south, and north,
All descend into the golden cauldron,
Auspicious tiger and dragon signs congeal within the profound darkness.
Chaos and light intermingle, radiance vast and boundless,
The boundless true void—
The true void refines the wondrous,
Refining the wondrous true void,
The true void conceals the profound.
Concealed void refines the wondrous, refining bedrock metal—
The wondrous divides the maiden,
Dui’s body engenders Ren.
This speaks of refining the wondrous to perfect the Spirit Chamber,
The Spirit Chamber’s brilliance opens, the spirit emerges and vanishes.
Emergence is brightness—
This speaks of refining the wondrous to unite as numen,
The numinous essence, crystalline, the spirit as qi.
Qi has no form,
Qi enters the profound darkness, traversing the indistinct.
Within the indistinct, at the center, dwells the numinous—
The numinous speaks of wondrous qi uniting as spirit.
Spirit moves qi, qi engenders the numinous,
The numinous is the child, qi the mother.
How could the Mysterious Origin’s Sacred Ancestor speak falsely?

It further speaks of refining the spirit to unite with the Dao,
Refining spirit to unite with the Dao—this is no ordinary Dao.
One should seek it diligently in the *Yin Fu Jing*,
Observe the heavens’ Way—what is the sky?
The sky has the Silver River, the chamber has what?
The chamber has the stellar river, constellations arrayed—
Zhang and Yi fly, Xu and Wei pursue.
The twenty-eight constellations revolve,
Water and fire tread in north and south.
Zi and Shen command, He and Fang unite,
White Tiger and Azure Dragon stand on either side.
The tiger roars, wind arises; the dragon spouts mist,
Mist and rosy clouds redden, outshining chaotic flames.

chunks.original_text: 红碎碎成颗颗，颗粒颗粒真珠红，红英紫脉生金公。 金公水土相并合，炼就黄芽成白雪，紫砂红粉乱飘飘，乱飘飘兮青龙膏。 红粉少白虎老，炼就龙膏并虎脑，长生殿生如意宝，点金万两何足道！ 何足道，能点衰翁永不老，长生殿药万万春，丽日滋生天柱明。 天柱明时魂交魄，蟾蛛兔髓汞浮白，魄感魂华生玉芝，广寒神舍垣娥宅。 飞光砂起震离束，金乌飞入广寒宫，灿火姻霞龙吐雾，绛砂坠落紫金红。 红英紫金金英紫，金英紫篆紫霞缕，缕金光透紫霞姻，红紫混成藏金色。 紫华耀日升金碧，金碧空青生紫华，翠霞澄碧接青霞，霞英灵景灵砂液。 砂脱离红青碧色，象则成形现杳冥，散则龙潜如鬼匿。 如鬼匿飞走水火难寻觅，砂汞附形生水火，不得真铅实不可。 实不可，砂隐铅中石隐火，击石见火火生姻，不击元姻体自然，砂隐铅中亦自然。 水养火滋才感激，感而遂通生金液，金液通神万古灵，焰焰通灵气与神。 神奔气运风雷鼓，鼓动风雷火生土，坎戊玄土金为父，离己牝土汞为母。 汞为母太上语，天下有始兮以为天下母，天上苍苍，晶灵飞光，真灵感召，砂汞飞光，飞光砂，炎火逼逼逐，熬熬声悲泣，其声河上应虚张，虚张何生，水激火烹。 火烹兮女气索，水激兮婴兄脱黑，脱黑则洁白见宝，气索则变红离色。 太阳明，太阳舒光为日新，日初新汞初凝，铅汞初凝兮丹象何陈。 丹象於天，出为日月，日为流珠，元气虚无，透金入石，神出鬼没。 神出兮神升天门，即日天魂； 鬼没兮鬼入地户，即曰地魄。 天魂地魄周宗祖，互为室宅分子午，水火交火生土，二土成圭银化金，离中火舍坎中精。 离中精光，天一伏藏，天藏其光，明亦不出，隐明内照，外通光耀。 光耀圆空，光明相通，是金火交圣日圣月，灵运潜通，紫灵神药，药有神通，通神阳火，焰焰烧空。 飞光布气，感而遂通，玉芝丹质，透霞入红。 入红兮火华光，分明照耀。 耀者离雌，照者坎雄，离雌坎雄，光明相通。 通雌入雄，变化无穷。 迭迭透霞兮华彩重重，华因二景，真木真金。 真木束方兮震雷生，震为长男兮震木生火。 震又为龙，龙从火行火真。 其西方兮兑藏金水水能调庚，兑为少女。 虎啸风生，风雨形声，迅速不停，形声绝影，金木交并，二气降灵，搏成金精。 金精大药，中有五行，五行神水，神水金浆，神水神火。 两相亲，火中水处，水中含金。 阳真汞受金气，震合庚辛入酉位，震受阳符渐成九爽利舒光。 震初有，从初入转震生灵坤，初六变成初九震。 照六庚庚属酉，震当五日为一候，震来受符六十时。 阳遁上元终则始，终於震卦始成兑，兑逐阴符坤六二，交爻变象莫能窥。 六二换阳成九二，此是金来入火乡，月行丁位半轮光，金何为火？ 何以兑感六丁？ 丁属己兑属金，丁属火，金火相交火生土，土生金，金火始兑，当五日为一候。 兑来受符，六十时阳遁中元，终则始。 终於兑卦始成乾，阳往阴来任自然。 阳极乾阴极坤，乾终九阴终六，六二六三兮三变成九，九三夕惕兮成乾体，盛明兮圆照束方甲。 六甲属兮乾当三五，乾当五日为一候，乾来受符六十时，阳遁下元兮前三十五，积一百八十时兮象半年，德就乾体交二八，阳极阴生兮乾体满，退阳就阴兮转受於巽，巽统阴符坤初六，六辛成巽成自十六，十六至二十六，巽将生艮。

Scarlet fragments shatter into beads,
Bead upon bead—true pearls of crimson,
Crimson blossoms with purple veins birth the Golden Duke.
Golden Duke joins with water and earth,
Refined into yellow sprouts that turn to white snow,
Purple sand and rouge swirl in disarray,
Swirling—Azure Dragon’s ointment.

The rouge, young; the White Tiger, aged,
Refined into dragon’s ointment and tiger’s marrow,
In the Hall of Longevity, the wish-fulfilling jewel is born,
What are ten thousand taels of gold to this?

What are ten thousand taels?
It can touch the withered elder, granting eternal youth,
The Hall of Longevity’s elixir brings myriad springs,
The radiant sun nourishes, the Pillar of Heaven gleams.

When the Pillar of Heaven gleams, soul and spirit unite,
Toad’s marrow and hare’s essence—mercury floats white,
Spirit responds to soul’s radiance, birthing jade mushrooms,
The Divine Mansion of Broad Cold, the palace of Chang’e.

Cinnabar’s flying light rises, shaking Li’s restraint,
The Golden Crow flies into the Palace of Broad Cold,
Flaming mists and rosy clouds—dragon’s exhaled vapor,
Vermilion cinnabar descends, purple-gold crimson.

Crimson blossoms of purple-gold, golden blossoms of purple,
Golden blossoms trace purple clouds in purple haze,
Haze threads golden light through purple mist,
Crimson and purple blend, concealing golden hue.

Purple radiance shines sunward, ascending golden-green,
Golden-green void-blue births purple radiance,
Verdant haze clears to azure, merging with blue mist,
Mist’s blossoms—numinous essence, numinous cinnabar sap.

Cinnabar sheds its crimson, turning azure-green,
In form, it manifests in the unseen,
Scattered, the dragon hides like a ghost in concealment.
Like a ghost in concealment, it flees—water and fire cannot trace it,
Yet when cinnabar and mercury cling to form, water and fire arise,
Without true lead, it truly cannot be.

Truly cannot be—
Cinnabar hides within lead, stone conceals fire,
Strike stone to see fire, fire births mist,
Without striking, the mist’s essence remains natural,
Cinnabar hidden in lead is also natural.

Water nurtures, fire nourishes—only then is there resonance,
Resonating, it penetrates, birthing golden liquid,
Golden liquid unites with spirit, eternally numinous,
Flaming, it connects spirit with qi.

Spirit rushes, qi moves—wind and thunder drum,
Drumming wind and thunder, fire gives birth to earth,
Kan’s wu, the mysterious earth—metal is the father,
Li’s ji, the receptive earth—mercury is the mother.

Mercury as mother—the Supreme’s words:
“The world has a beginning, which is the mother of all under heaven.”
Heaven above, vast and azure,
Crystal numinosity, flying light,
True numinosity summons—cinnabar and mercury take flight,
Flying light of cinnabar,
Fiery flames press close in pursuit,
Boiling, the sound is mournful,
Its voice echoes over rivers, responding to emptiness,
What does emptiness give birth to?
Water’s surge, fire’s seething.

Fire seethes—the Weaver Girl’s qi wanes,
Water surges—the Infant Boy sheds blackness,
Shedding black, purity reveals the treasure,
Qi wanes—red departs from its hue.

The Great Yang shines,
The Great Yang unfurls its light, renewing daily,
The sun’s renewal—mercury’s first coagulation,
Lead and mercury’s first coagulation—what form does the elixir take?

The elixir’s form in heaven
Emerges as sun and moon,
The sun as a flowing pearl,
Primal qi’s emptiness and nothingness,
Piercing metal, entering stone,
Spirit emerges, ghost vanishes.

Spirit emerges—spirit ascends to Heaven’s Gate,
At once the celestial soul;
Ghost vanishes—ghost enters Earth’s Door,
At once the terrestrial spirit.
Celestial soul and terrestrial spirit encircle the ancestral origin,
Mutually serving as chambers, dividing at zi and wu,
Water and fire intersect, fire gives birth to earth,
Two earths form the gui, silver transforms into gold,
Li’s fire chamber holds Kan’s essence.

Li’s essence-light,
Heaven’s One lies hidden,
Heaven conceals its light,
Brightness does not emerge,
Hidden brightness shines within,
Externally, it connects with radiance.

Radiance fills the void,
Light and brightness interpenetrate,
This is the sacred day and sacred month where metal and fire meet,
Numinous movement subtly connects,
The purple numinous elixir,
The elixir possesses numinous power,
Uniting with yang fire,
Flaming, it burns the void.

Flying light spreads qi,
Resonating, it penetrates,
Jade mushroom’s elixir essence,
Pierces mist, enters crimson.

Entering crimson—fire’s blossom-light,
Clearly illuminating.
The illuminator is Li’s feminine,
The illuminator is Kan’s masculine,
Li’s feminine and Kan’s masculine,
Light and brightness interpenetrate.

Penetrating the feminine into the masculine,
Transformations are boundless.
Layer upon layer, piercing mist—blossoms upon blossoms,
Blossoms arise from the two luminaries,
True Wood, true Metal.
True Wood binds the east—Zhen’s thunder arises,
Zhen is the eldest son—Zhen’s Wood gives birth to fire.
Zhen is also the dragon,
The dragon follows fire’s path—fire is true.

Its west—Dui conceals Metal and Water,
Water can harmonize with geng,
Dui is the youngest daughter.
Tiger’s roar births wind,
Wind and rain take form and sound,
Swift and ceaseless,
Form and sound leave no trace,
Metal and Wood intersect,
The two qi descend with numinosity,
Forge into golden essence.

Golden essence, the great elixir,
Within it, the Five Phases,
The Five Phases’ numinous water,
Numinous water’s golden nectar,
Numinous water, numinous fire.
The two are intimate,
Water within fire,
Gold contained in water.

True yang mercury receives metal’s qi,
Zhen unites with geng and xin, entering the you position,
Zhen receives the yang tally, gradually forming the ninefold brilliance of radiant light.
Zhen’s initial presence,
From the beginning, entering the turning Zhen, giving birth to numinous Kun,
The initial six transforms into Zhen’s initial nine.
Illuminating the six geng—geng belongs to you,
Zhen governs five days as one pentad,
Zhen arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours.

The upper yang cycle ends and begins anew,
Ending at Zhen, beginning at Dui,
Dui pursues the yin tally, Kun’s six-two,
Exchanging lines, the image’s transformation cannot be fathomed.
Six-two changes to yang, becoming nine-two,
This is metal entering the realm of fire,
The moon traverses the ding position, half-wheel light,
Why does metal serve fire?
How does Dui resonate with six ding?

Ding belongs to ji, Dui to metal,
Ding belongs to fire,
Metal and fire intersect, fire gives birth to earth,
Earth gives birth to metal,
Metal and fire begin at Dui,
Governing five days as one pentad.
Dui arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours,
The middle yang cycle,
Ending and beginning anew.
Ending at Dui, beginning at Qian,
Yang departs, yin arrives—naturally so.

Yang’s extremity is Qian, yin’s extremity is Kun,
Qian ends at nine, yin ends at six,
Six-two and six-three—three changes form nine,
Nine-three, vigilant at dusk—forming Qian’s body,
In full brilliance, it roundly illuminates the east’s jia.
The six jia belong—Qian governs three and five,
Qian governs five days as one pentad,
Qian arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours,
The lower yang cycle—thirty-five preceding,
Accumulating one hundred eighty hours—symbolizing half a year,
Virtue completes Qian’s body, uniting the two eights,
Yang’s extremity gives birth to yin—Qian’s body is full,
Retreating yang, approaching yin—turning to receive at Xun,
Xun governs the yin tally, Kun’s initial six,
Six xin forms Xun, forming from sixteen,
Sixteen to twenty-six,
Xun is about to give birth to Gen.

chunks.original_text: 巽当五日为一候，巽来受符六十时，阴遁上元终则始。 终於巽卦始成艮，巽艮交爻象已定。 象已定，艮合六丙当受巽，六一巽六二艮，六三加临阴巳盛。 阴盛水旺火将残，二十三日属下弦。 下弦艮火自合亏，艮当五日为一候，止艮来受符，六十时阴遁中元，终则始。 终於艮卦始成坤，坤象黑，乙癸六三兮坤它乙，六一属坤兮三十日，坤当五日为一候毕。 坤来受符六十时，阴遁下元终则始，始於前前三五，终於后后三五。 六候昏明受寒暑，昏明晦朔运推移，晦积一百八十时象半年前弦之后后弦前，六候三旬象一年，一年全用十二节，卦火亏盈逐一月。 一月六候一周天，先天而后绩后天，时计一万零三千。 一万三千符火足，准三年。 三年火炼流珠鼎，鼎似招阳聚天镜，鼎中光映日霞红，霞映日魂来合鼎。 合鼎日红传晷景，晷景南行日至丙，日至丙午爻并汞，冲神室。 神饮景，饮景沉醉醉复醒，神气冲和神酩酊。 神酩酊，绵绵焰焰，通灵光运圆。 光明镜面火晶盘，晶盘散撒如金粟。 金粟火华荧惑，醉如柳麦色黄深，太仓神舍盘盈盈。 盈盈闪烁晶赫赫，夜属月魂鼎象白。 鼎象白兮是月圆，鼎通天，天上月圆鼎亦然。 天上鼎内卦属乾，乾物，鼎圆明运月圆，光如镜面水晶盘，炼出银蟾似月圆。 月圆望盈巽损侧，晦属阴符鼎象黑，朔象白晦象黑，黑白亏盈或圆缺，圆缺之中，月明中夜听更漏。 漏才终当日视晷盘，久晷景忘前日落，酉落霞红，象应丹砂。 鼎内同映结红霞。 鼎玲珑玲，珑火化华芙蓉，火符结撮日洪蒙，洪蒙不是寻常入口美味甘如蜜。 因食不觉体随风，轻举飞腾骯太空。 骯太空显仙宗，莫言来世又相逢，太愚蒙，休谈妙有说真空。 是非同，空即是色，色是空，其色苍苍照耀红。 与君说破我家风，太阳移在月明中，月明太阳天上药，人服之时跨鸾鹤。 万法千门都是错，学取吾家这一着，这一着，跳出五行真快乐。 金鼎虚无论 余闻上古修丹。 须凭法，妙会多生，夙契相遇成真，是谓共获，生天地之灵也。 或问：天地之灵，生於何所？ 答日：凿开混沌，土分黄黑色，生天地之金精，深藏溟滓，为道之根本，羽客受得，可造金鼎。 且金鼎者，夫何为生？ 何为而有？ 日：生自无形，无名之始，有何为万物之母，子得金精作命基，命基只是金华池，华池神水太渊晶，太渊金晶绝万灵，万灵号日万物母，先圣将来为鼎金。 鼎金元来药里寻，寻来不是世问金，世问金，何足异，金鼎鼎金通天地，通得三光鼎受符，汞侵金鼎气生虚，虚气生虚无生有，有生无，元有虚无。 虚化枢，枢纽的然真种类，何忧水火不吹嘘。 水润下水在上，魄吸水银魂荡样，火在下火炎上，火养水生逐爻象。 阳象流珠水作丹，阴象随金逐水长，金水火名三五，金三五，金主策外汞相处，震青龙兑白虎，乾体圆明金三五。 金渐晦水渐举，白虎亏盈变黑虎，玄武阴生入癸乡，巽艮还坤水三五。 金为子水为母，阴符阳火分子午，刚柔文武运推移，火生火灭化为土。 此是火三五，水火交四维，金作火将衰，一作水将生火则终火则始，衰则终生则始，定浮沉兮金化水，分刻漏白化黑，黑则终白则始，黑白往来逐月矣！ 知白来守黑去，三百六十有五度。
chunks.translated_text:
Xun governs five days as one pentad,
Xun arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours,
The upper yin cycle—ending then beginning.

Ending at Xun’s hexagram, beginning to form Gen,
Xun and Gen exchange lines—images now fixed.
Images now fixed, Gen unites with six bing to receive Xun,
Six-one Xun, six-two Gen,
Six-three presses near—yin flourishes in full.

Yin flourishes, water waxes as fire wanes,
The twenty-third day belongs to the last quarter.
Last quarter—Gen’s fire naturally wanes,
Gen governs five days as one pentad,
Ceasing at Gen, it arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours,
The middle yin cycle—ending then beginning.

Ending at Gen’s hexagram, beginning to form Kun,
Kun’s image is black,
Yi and gui’s six-three—Kun’s yi,
Six-one belongs to Kun—thirty days,
Kun governs five days as one pentad complete.

Kun arrives to receive the tally for sixty hours,
The lower yin cycle—ending then beginning,
Beginning at the prior three-five,
Ending at the latter three-five.
Six pentads—dusk and dawn receive cold and heat,
Dusk and dawn, darkness and new moon—shifting in turn,
Darkness accumulates one hundred eighty hours—symbolizing half a year,
After the prior quarter, before the latter quarter,
Six pentads, three decades—symbolizing one year,
One year fully employs twelve nodes,
Hexagram fire wanes and waxes through each month.

One month, six pentads—one celestial cycle,
First the prior heaven, then the succeeding heaven,
Time tallies ten thousand three hundred.
Ten thousand three thousand—fire tally complete,
Standard for three years.

Three years—fire refines the flowing-pearl tripod,
The tripod resembles summoning yang to gather the celestial mirror,
Within the tripod, light reflects the sun’s rosy glow,
Glow reflects the sun’s essence to unite with the tripod.

Uniting the tripod, the sun’s red transmits the gnomon’s shadow,
The gnomon’s shadow moves south to the sun’s bing,
The sun reaches bing-noon—lines merge with mercury,
Striking the spirit chamber.
Spirit drinks the shadow,
Drinking the shadow, deeply drunk—drunk then sober,
Spirit and qi harmonize—spirit mellows.

Spirit mellows,
Trailing flames, flickering,
Circulating numinous light in a circle.
Light—mirror’s surface, fire’s crystal plate,
The crystal plate scatters like golden grains.
Golden grains—fire’s radiance, Mars’ glow,
Drunk like willow and wheat—color deep yellow,
The Grand Granary’s spirit abode—plate brimming.
Brimming, glinting—crystal radiance,
Night belongs to the moon’s essence—tripod’s image white.

Tripod’s image white—this is the moon’s fullness,
Tripod connects to heaven,
In heaven, the moon is full—so too the tripod.
In heaven, within the tripod—hexagram belongs to Qian,
Qian’s substance,
Tripod’s round brightness moves with the moon’s fullness,
Light like a mirror’s surface, a crystal plate,
Refining silver toad—moon-round.
Moon full, waxing at Xun—waning at its side,
Darkness belongs to yin tally—tripod’s image black,
New moon’s image white, darkness’ image black,
Black and white, waning and waxing—round and crescent,
Within round and crescent,
Moon bright at midnight—listen to the watchman’s clepsydra.

As the clepsydra ends, the day gazes at the gnomon’s plate,
Long gazing at the shadow—forgetting the prior day’s sunset,
Sunset at you—rosy glow,
Image responds to cinnabar.
Within the tripod, together reflecting—knotting red glow.

Tripod—exquisite, resonant,
Resonant fire transforms into lotus,
Fire tally knots—gathering the sun’s primordial chaos,
Primordial chaos—not the ordinary sweetness of honey on the tongue.
Feeding, unaware—body follows the wind,
Lightly rising, soaring—riding the great void.
Riding the great void—revealing the immortal lineage,
Do not speak of meeting again in the next life,
Too foolish and ignorant,
Cease discussing wondrous being—speak of true emptiness.

Right and wrong the same,
Emptiness is precisely form, form is emptiness,
Its color—verdant, shining red.
I reveal to you my family’s tradition,
The great yang moves within the moon’s brightness,
Moon’s brightness—great yang, heaven’s medicine,
When one ingests it—riding simurgh and crane.
Ten thousand methods, a thousand gates—all are mistaken,
Learn this one move of my family,
This one move—leaping beyond the five phases, truly joyous.

The golden tripod—empty, without discussion.
I have heard that in high antiquity, refining the elixir
Must rely on method,
Wondrously meeting across many lives,
Predestined affinity—encountering to become true,
This is called mutual attainment,
Gaining the numen of heaven and earth.

Someone asks: The numen of heaven and earth,
Born from where?
Answer: Chiseling open primordial chaos,
Earth divides into yellow and black,
Giving birth to heaven and earth’s golden essence,
Deeply hidden in the murky depths,
As the Dao’s root,
When feathered guests obtain it, they can create the golden tripod.

Moreover, the golden tripod—
From what is it born?
From what does it arise?
Answer: Born from formless,
The beginning of the nameless,
The mother of the ten thousand things—what is it?
The child obtains golden essence to establish the foundation of life,
The foundation of life is merely the golden flower’s pool,
The flower pool’s spirit water—great abyss’ crystal,
The great abyss’ golden crystal—surpassing the ten thousand numina,
The ten thousand numina are called the mother of the ten thousand things,
Former sages took it to make the tripod’s gold.

Tripod’s gold—originally sought within medicine,
Sought—it is not the world’s gold,
The world’s gold—what is extraordinary?
Golden tripod, tripod’s gold—connecting heaven and earth,
Connecting the three luminaries, the tripod receives the tally,
Mercury invades the golden tripod—qi generates emptiness,
Empty qi generates emptiness—nothing generates being,
Being generates nothing,
Originally having nothing—nothing.
Nothing transforms the pivot,
The pivot’s natural true kind,
Why worry water and fire will not nurture?

Water moistens downward—water above,
Po absorbs mercury—hun sways the pattern,
Fire below—fire flames upward,
Fire nurtures water—generating according to line images.
Yang image—flowing pearl, water makes the elixir,
Yin image—following metal, water grows,
Metal, water, fire—named three-five,
Metal three-five,
Metal governs the exterior—mercury dwells alongside,
Zhen’s green dragon, Dui’s white tiger,
Qian’s body—round brightness, metal three-five.

Metal gradually darkens, water gradually rises,
White tiger wanes and waxes—transforming into black tiger,
Xuanwu—yin born, entering gui’s realm,
Xun, Gen return to Kun—water three-five.
Metal as child, water as mother,
Yin tally, yang fire—dividing zi and wu,
Hard and soft, civil and martial—shifting in turn,
Fire born, fire extinguished—transforming into earth.

This is fire three-five,
Water and fire intersect the four directions,
Metal acts as fire—about to wane,
Once as water—about to generate fire then ending, fire then beginning,
Waning then ending, generating then beginning,
Fixed floating and sinking—metal transforms into water,
Dividing the clepsydra—white transforms into black,
Black then ending, white then beginning,
Black and white come and go—following the moon!

Knowing white, come to guard black—depart,
Three hundred sixty-five degrees.

chunks.original_text: 开生门闭死户，水火优游居鼎釜，水火无差药有灵，为何灵？ 水消烁火熏蒸，水火为媒招日魂，魂张神碎飞阳华，魄啖魂华食碧砂。 食碧砂食马牙，马牙灵异世无比，得号流魂。 魂涉水水涉魂，震阳明，天符降奉，日晨准日讫，急急如律令。 劝追魂来伏虎窟，呼吸风云水火入，水火烹轰虎喷声。 水灵晶火灵晶，水灵火灵魄与魂，魄灵能吸魂灵晶。 魂吸魄魄吸魂，魂吸魄兮魂定鼎，魄吸魂兮魄鼎魂。 且魂鼎者，制伏水银不飞扬，翱翔戏鼎光，散霞消烁烁紫金红粉故曰魂定。 定则不动，动则火直，火直往来，不往不来，着而成宝。 且魄鼎者，玄武宁静，静则金生水，金能生水，水乃澄明，明生聚景故日魄，鼎乃是也。 金养水火养金，魂恋魄魄恋魂，自然金鼎宰神明，产出丹砂性合情，不是朱砂及水银。 大药金丹三八品，万象爻铢列金鼎，水火加临有浅探，二十四气相推准。 视之不见听不闻，高寿妙年修金鼎，烧成无价珍，回阳换骨紫消金。 紫消金通神灵，金乌入阳光进，青霞舞红霞运，青红同入归金鼎，修成造化炉，九还七返炼虚无。 七返炼成红玉粉，九还炼就紫金酥。 紫金酥红玉粉，魂和魄魄和魂，元有虚无虚化神。 神化气，气化水，水化木，木化火，火化土，土化金，金化水。 钻，簇五行金鼎裹，腾腾两曜运光辉。 水飞火飞，离化火，坎化水，水激火，火激水，离咀坎，坎咀离，相咀相嚼碎虹蜕虹蚬气结如屑硝，马齿搓牙光皎洁。 。 光逐人生虎魄中，紫金台上凝霜雪，色若琼瑶虚飘飘，阳气轻清轻拂拂。 轻清阳砂光耀日，耀耀争光砂夺色，荧煌晃晃黄舆灵，舆灵能点化生灵，舆灵本在扶桑出，体因砂有铅中得，腾光粟乱星飞乱，星研细，青龙骨，至神至圣飞腾物，飞腾不飞何得知？ 试将些子望空掷，果然能有回天力。 丹砂高奔登空，朱见走入金乌窟，轻清阳光养阳药，华射阳光光射药，相辉相烁混其光，吸吸紫华升太阳。 太阴太阳真水火，水克火灭太化为土，隐明伏火土潜辉，潜辉藏虚虚化气，虚气接连通上下。 通上下兮火随卦，卦火亏盈盈则昌。 照阳光火着光，几千万丈，光生火昌，阳晶逐火火招阳，阳燧烁日兮照阳无穷无极，火胜光冲运气光，光彻地地通元气，火随光，火气运行生万物，目前火化晖阳光。 阳燧聚阳光感激，感而遂通生恍惚，荣荣赫焰阳精，光透姻生火折灿。 阳光随入黄金舍照耀乾坤砂世界，金砂喷火散阳光，大地阳光生世界。 光逐神生神逐光，大千沙界此中藏，劫尽恒河沙世界，一砂一劫失阳光。 阳光既失何所名，龙汉延康至赤明，此言劫数已沉沦，劫力难逃不可闻。 黑风飘荡失三才，倒岳摧山尽作尘，地水火风皆席卷，屋宇楼台尽底沉。 蠢动含灵皆失养，不分南北与束西，森罗万象无踪迹，五行四象何所觅。 声响声形不可逃。 混混元光皆暗黑，玄寂寂，复玄玄，不明探处至深极。 至深极，则返还元，返本还元天地先。 天地先，一气能分天地元，元黄正气真一祖，能生万象为丹母，因母立兆作丹基，兆召青腰使者归。 青腰召入留光殿，炼作窗尘光不现，窗尘亦名日黄埃。 太阳变，太阳变则有何为，水火通流十二时，十二时无中有子午，卯酉分四九，四九火钻三十六，子午卯酉分南北。
chunks.translated_text:
Opening the Gate of Life and sealing the Door of Death,
water and fire roam leisurely within the crucible and cauldron.
Water and fire without error—yet the medicine holds numinous power.
Why numinous?
Water dissolves, fire steams and seethes,
water and fire act as matchmakers to summon the solar soul.
The soul expands, the spirit shatters—yang’s radiance takes flight,
the po devours the soul’s bloom and feeds on azure sand.

Feeding on azure sand, feeding on horse-tooth spar,
horse-tooth spar’s numinous marvel unmatched in the world—
earning the name "flowing soul."
Soul crosses water, water crosses soul,
thunder shakes yang brightness—heavenly tally descends in obeisance.
Daybreak aligns with the sun’s end—
*hasten, hasten, as in the statutes and ordinances!*

Urge the soul to pursue and tame the tiger’s den,
breathing in wind and clouds, drawing in water and fire.
Water and fire boil and roar—the tiger’s roar resounds.

Water’s numinous essence gleams, fire’s numinous essence gleams,
water’s numinous spirit, fire’s numinous spirit—po and hun.
The po’s numen can absorb the hun’s luminous essence.
Hun absorbs po, po absorbs hun—
hun absorbs po, then hun settles the crucible;
po absorbs hun, then po crucibles the hun.

Now, the hun-crucible:
it subdues and restrains mercury, preventing it from flying,
soaring and playing within the crucible’s light.
Scattered rosy clouds dissolve in searing brilliance—
purple gold and rouge powder—thus called "hun settled."
Settled, it does not move; moved, fire rises straight.
Fire’s straight ascent and descent—
neither going nor coming—
when applied, it becomes treasure.

Now, the po-crucible:
Xuanwu’s tranquility—
tranquil, then metal generates water.
Metal can generate water—
water then clarifies and brightens.
Brightness gives rise to gathered radiance—thus called "po,"
the crucible is indeed this.

Metal nurtures water, fire nurtures metal,
hun longs for po, po longs for hun—
naturally, the golden crucible governs spirit and brightness,
producing cinnabar whose nature aligns with essence—
not mere cinnabar or mercury.

The great medicine, the golden elixir—three times eight grades,
myriad images and hexagrams arrayed within the golden crucible.
Water and fire applied with depth and precision,
the twenty-four qi mutually advance and align.

Seen yet unseen, heard yet unheard,
long life and wondrous years refine the golden crucible.
Fired into priceless treasure—
reversing yang, transmuting bones into purple dissolution and gold.

Purple dissolution and gold commune with spirit and numen,
the golden crow enters yang—light advances.
Azure rosy clouds dance, crimson rosy clouds move,
azure and crimson together return to the golden crucible.
Refined into the alchemical furnace—
nine returns, seven reversions smelt the void.

Seven reversions smelt into red jade powder,
nine returns smelt into purple gold nectar.
Purple gold nectar, red jade powder—
hun harmonizes with po, po harmonizes with hun.
Originally possessing void, void transforms into spirit.

Spirit transforms into qi, qi transforms into water,
water transforms into wood, wood transforms into fire,
fire transforms into earth, earth transforms into metal,
metal transforms into water.
Drill, cluster the five phases within the golden crucible—
the two luminaries ascend in radiant splendor.

Water flies, fire flies—
Li transforms into fire, Kan transforms into water.
Water excites fire, fire excites water—
Li chews Kan, Kan chews Li,
mutually chewing, grinding like rainbow-shedding, rainbow-shedding qi,
condensing into saltpeter-like fragments.
Horse-tooth spar’s teeth gleam with luminous purity.

Light pursues the living into tiger’s amber,
on the purple gold terrace, frost and snow congeal.
Its hue like jade, ethereally drifting—
yang qi, light and pure, gently wafting.

Light and pure yang sand gleams like the sun,
glittering, vying in brilliance—sand outshines color.
Flickering, resplendent—yellow chariot’s numen,
the chariot’s numen can transmute and quicken life.
The chariot’s numen originally emerges from Fusang,
its essence found within lead, derived from sand.
Its ascending light scatters like grain, stars fly in disarray.
Stars ground fine—azure dragon’s bones—
the most divine, most sagely flying substance.
If it does not fly, how can one know?
Test by tossing a bit into the void—
surely it possesses the power to return to heaven.

Cinnabar soars high, ascending into the sky,
vermilion seen rushing into the golden crow’s den.
Light and pure yang nurtures the yang medicine—
radiance shoots toward yang, light illuminates the medicine.
Mutually shining, mutually searing—merging their light,
breath by breath, purple radiance ascends to the Great Yang.

Great Yin and Great Yang—true water and fire.
Water overcomes fire, fire extinguishes—greatly transforming into earth.
Hidden brightness, subdued fire—earth’s latent radiance,
latent radiance conceals void, void transforms into qi.
Void qi connects, linking above and below.

Linking above and below—fire follows the hexagrams.
Hexagram fire waxes and wanes—when full, it prospers.
Illuminating yang’s light, fire ignites brilliance—
countless thousands of miles.
Light generates fire’s prosperity—
yang’s essence pursues fire, fire summons yang.
Yang’s burning mirror sears the sun—
illuminating yang without end or limit.
Fire triumphs, light surges—qi’s light circulates.
Light penetrates the earth, earth connects with primordial qi.
Fire follows light, fire’s qi circulates—generating the ten thousand things.
Before one’s eyes, fire transforms, shining with yang’s light.

Yang’s burning mirror gathers yang’s light, stirring and resonating.
Stirred, it then connects—generating the indistinct.
Flourishing, blazing flames—yang’s essence.
Light pierces mist, giving birth to fire’s dazzling splendor.

Yang’s light follows into the golden abode,
illuminating the Qian and Kun’s cinnabar world.
Golden sand sprays fire, scattering yang’s light—
the great earth’s yang light generates the world.

Light pursues spirit, spirit pursues light—
the great thousand-worlds of sand lie hidden within.
When kalpas exhaust the Ganges’ sands of worlds,
one grain of sand, one kalpa—yang’s light is lost.

Yang’s light lost—what name remains?
From Dragon Han to Yan Kang, to Crimson Brightness—
these speak of kalpas already sunken and drowned,
kalpa’s power inescapable, unheard of.

Black winds drift, losing the Three Powers,
toppling peaks, collapsing mountains—all reduced to dust.
Earth, water, fire, wind—all swept away,
houses and towers, all utterly submerged.

All creatures, all life lose sustenance,
no distinction between south, north, east, or west.
The forest of myriad images—no trace remains,
the five phases, four images—where to seek?

Sound, resonance, form—inescapable.
Chaotic primordial light all darkens—
profoundly still, returning to profound profundity,
unilluminated depths reaching the utmost extreme.

At the utmost extreme, it returns to the origin,
reverting to the root, returning to the origin—before heaven and earth.
Before heaven and earth—
one qi can divide heaven and earth’s origin.
Primordial yellow’s upright qi—true unity’s ancestor,
able to generate the myriad images as the elixir’s mother.
By the mother, omens are established—forming the elixir’s foundation.
Omens summon the Azure Waist messenger to return.

The Azure Waist is summoned into the Hall of Lingering Light,
refined into window dust—light no longer appears.
Window dust is also called "sun’s yellow haze."

The Great Yang transforms—
when the Great Yang transforms, what occurs?
Water and fire flow through the twelve hours,
within the twelve hours, zi and wu exist in the center.
Mao and you divide the four nines—
four nines, fire drills thirty-six.
Zi and wu, mao and you divide north and south.

Water and fire intersect the four directions,
Metal acts as fire—about to wane,
Once as water—about to generate fire then ending, fire then beginning,
Waning then ending, generating then beginning,
Fixed floating and sinking—metal transforms into water,

chunks.original_text: 午属阳，阴火发，辰戌丑未分四八，四八火钻三十二，水火烹煎成既济。 子属阴阳火发，寅申巳亥分四八，四八火钻三十二，百刻时辰分昼夜。 昼为暑夜为寒，寒暑分明顺阴阳，阴阳两分如鸡子，生死常七在始终。 三日庚生震受西，谓魂生坤在束北，魄丧乙谓魂死，死生相接无休息，木三金四合成七，阴阳两分分两弦，合就金胎坤合乾，包裹乾坤须固密。 手搏日月为神室，坎殿光辉张丽华，神室圆明三五一。 三五庚震兑乾，坤包乙癸为阴乙，包藏弦望晦朔宫，黑白亏盈吉或凶。 吉当圆满凶却缺，神明变气失符节，金胎神室象太阴，不信但观天上月。 黄白在裹立精魂，魄白魂黄魂入魄，黄如白白回黄，精黑转回黄转黑，混其精魂炼魄黑。 散光生现黄白，黄白团圆光相接，生天太阳生地月，虎吸龙光透体明，白金胎内产黄金。 黄金白金分二八，万古传流不敢泄，说与凡流却不信，不信但教如华看。 向上元来有一着，认取生天生地药，生天生地亦生人，君且思量仔细寻。 寻得之时赴玉京，跨鸾骑鹤君上升 明堂正德论 夫明堂者，其名有三：夏曰世室，商曰重室，周号明堂，为天子布正德之宫，臣僚序尊卑之所。 明堂奉日门，立正阳。 上古及今尊真神所得号明堂者，黄帝於荆山，炼金液神丹，造玄一室，其室附火而生阳光，积阳为明，亦称明堂，又日苍精神舍。 应日月之象，作神明之所，其所方广，大明四通，灵神通灵。 神者水火风云也，水火归藏 ，火藏离所，水归坎乡。 风云龙虎，举西合东，毕勖尾箕，二十八宿。 乌坠庚辛，感化生育，气平西方，水火金木，相克相生，五行返覆。 逆则招祸，顺则致福，喜则或具太平，怒则或生兵革不祥，立见灾殃。 丘陵。 戈戟，杀气侵天，飞砂走石，慧星彷徨，惊飞太白，国有倾危，火难调燮。 致令金水周彰，龙虎烹轰。 如是则阴阳相胜，相生相杀之象也。 且兵革者，金火鼓动之象也。 喜动轰雷，雷轰震响，震响者是阳明火燥，火燥伤金，为姻散失，金液何求？ 炎火谩张，空设下，玄珠烧损火虫饥，魄弱魂飞，则灵丹远矣！ ．水不可大盛，盛则阴侵其肠，阴立则阳不满，阳不能胜其阴，厥阴鼓风，推伤损木。 损木者神，龙虎抱疾，疾中有丙，故日病。 病者日月不换丙，不换丙者，数差其偶也。 阳失其契，阴侵其明，此乃阴阳不交之象也。 若阴阳不定，则四象不立，八卦未分。 且丹砂从何而生哉？ 火体阴阳，得中水火，两者耗器凭胜负，在丹基之坚固。 故府仰免疏虞，体两弦，合金水变化，生虚无，托药化。 药化有还光，化药无中有，还有是还无，无则无固必，有是固谁质，有无两端的，听吾聊陈悉。 且无者水木金木之气，四方隐於虚无，且道藏乎其中矣！ ．此言无质成形，形生何所？ 不达无理，辄敢妄评。 天地之精灵，不可轻举，惜乎未得炼之可取炼之未得别也难图。 且有者土金玄黄之器，其器得火而施张得，则设生感召，始则若有若无，若有则霏霏微微，道隐希夷，希则感而氤氤，夷则动而氲氲。 希夷感动，氤氲橐钥，始之肇基，立兆已萌，太阴化生。 化者神运，神运气化，凝委而成形质。 形质苍苍，霞火流光，光华精结，精红透魄，红影来朝，结就玉霄绛霄霞结，号离红屑，离红飞扬，轻红翱翔，神物飞扬，五色翱翔，，翱翔五色，太阳光青。
chunks.translated_text:
Wu belongs to yang—yin fire arises.
Chen, xu, chou, wei divide the four eights,
four eights, fire drills thirty-two,
water and fire simmer and boil to achieve completion.

Zi belongs to yin—yang fire arises.
Yin, shen, si, hai divide the four eights,
four eights, fire drills thirty-two,
a hundred marks of time divide day and night.
Day is heat, night is cold,
cold and heat clearly follow yin and yang.
Yin and yang divide like a chicken’s egg,
life and death ever cycle in seven at beginning and end.

On the third day, geng arises in Zhen, received by Dui in the west—
this is the soul born in Kun, dwelling in the northeast.
The po perishes in yi—this is the soul’s death.
Death and life connect without cease.
Wood three, metal four combine to make seven,
yin and yang divide into two crescents.
When metal womb and Kun unite with Qian,
envelop Qian and Kun—must be firmly sealed.

Hand-capture sun and moon to form the spirit chamber,
Kan’s palace radiates with Zhang Lihua’s brilliance.
The spirit chamber is round and bright—three, five, one.
Three, five: geng, Zhen, Dui, Qian.
Kun envelops yi and gui as yin yi,
hiding crescent, full, waning, and new moons’ palaces.
Black and white, waxing and waning—fortune or misfortune.
Fortune should be full, misfortune deficient.
When spirit and qi transform, losing rhythm,
the metal womb and spirit chamber resemble the Great Yin.
If you doubt, just observe the moon above.

Yellow and white within establish essence and soul,
po white, hun yellow—hun enters po.
Yellow becomes white, white returns to yellow,
essence black turns back, yellow turns black,
blend essence and hun to refine po’s blackness.

Scattered light reveals yellow and white,
yellow and white coalesce, their lights connecting.
Heaven’s Great Yang is born, earth’s moon is born.
The tiger inhales the dragon’s light—body becomes luminous.
Within the white metal womb, yellow gold is produced.
Yellow gold and white gold divide two and eight,
passed down through ages—dare not leak.
Tell the common folk, yet they will not believe.
If they doubt, just let them observe like Hua.

Above, there is originally one move—
recognize the medicine that births heaven, earth, and man.
Heaven-born, earth-born—also man-born.
You must ponder and seek carefully.
When found, ascend to Jade Capital,
riding phoenix and crane, you ascend.

*On the Hall of Luminous Virtue*
The Hall of Luminous Virtue has three names:
in Xia, it is called the Generational Chamber;
in Shang, the Double Chamber;
in Zhou, the Hall of Luminous Virtue.
It is the palace where the Son of Heaven enacts upright virtue,
where ministers and officials arrange hierarchy.

The Hall of Luminous Virtue venerates the Gate of the Solar Door,
establishing the Upright Yang.
From ancient times to now, those who honor true spirits
are called the Hall of Luminous Virtue.
The Yellow Emperor, on Jing Mountain,
refined the golden liquid divine elixir,
built the Chamber of Primordial Unity.
Its chamber, kindled by fire, generated yang light.
Accumulated yang becomes luminous—
also called the Hall of Luminous Virtue,
or the Azure Spirit Abode.

Responding to the images of sun and moon,
it becomes the dwelling of spirit and brightness.
Its dimensions vast, great luminosity in four directions,
spirits and gods communicate with the numinous.
Spirits are water, fire, wind, and clouds.
Water and fire return to storage—
fire stores in the abode of Li,
water returns to the land of Kan.
Wind and clouds, dragon and tiger,
west rises to meet east,
completing Xu and Wei, Tail and Winnowing Basket—
the twenty-eight constellations.
The crow falls in geng and xin,
stimulating transformation and birth.
Qi levels in the west,
water, fire, metal, wood—
mutually overcoming, mutually generating,
the five phases reverse and repeat.
Reversed, they invite misfortune;
aligned, they bring fortune.
Joy may bring great peace,
anger may spawn weapons and war, inauspicious omens,
disasters appearing instantly.

Mountains and hills,
halberds and spears—
killing qi invades the heavens,
sand flies, stones roll,
comets wander,
Venus startles the skies.
The state faces collapse and peril,
fire’s harmony is disrupted.
Thus metal and water circulate in brilliance,
dragon and tiger simmer and roar.
Such is the image of yin and yang overcoming,
mutually generating and killing.

Moreover, weapons and war
are the image of metal and fire’s stirring.
Joy stirs thunder’s roar,
thunder roars with shaking resonance.
Shaking resonance is yang brightness’s fiery dryness—
fire’s dryness harms metal,
scattering marriage and loss.
What seeks the metal liquid?
Blazing fire spreads wildly,
vainly setting below—
the dark pearl burns, fire worms hunger,
po weakens, hun flies—
then the divine elixir is far indeed!

Water must not be too abundant—
abundance lets yin invade its viscera.
Yin stands, then yang is not full.
Yang cannot overcome yin—
Jueyin drums wind,
pushing to harm and damage wood.
Damaged wood is spirit,
dragon and tiger embrace illness.
Within illness lies bing—
thus it is called disease.
Disease means sun and moon do not exchange bing,
not exchanging bing means numbers diverge from their pairs.
Yang loses its contract,
yin invades its brightness—
this is the image of yin and yang not uniting.

If yin and yang are unsettled,
then the four images do not stand,
the eight trigrams are not divided.
Moreover, whence does cinnabar arise?
Fire’s body is yin and yang,
attaining the mean of water and fire.
The two deplete the vessel, relying on victory or defeat,
on the elixir foundation’s firmness.
Thus, facing and turning avoid negligence,
embodying the two crescents,
uniting metal and water’s transformations,
giving birth to emptiness,
entrusting the medicine’s transformation.
The medicine’s transformation has returning light—
within no-thing, there is something.
Returning something is returning nothing—
nothing is nothing’s firm necessity,
something is firmness’s essence.
The two ends of being and non-being—
listen as I briefly expound.

Moreover, non-being is the qi of water, wood, metal, and earth,
the four directions concealed in emptiness.
Moreover, the Dao is stored within it!
This speaks of formless form taking shape—
where does shaped form arise?
Not grasping the principle of non-being,
dare not rashly evaluate.
Heaven and earth’s essence and spirit
must not be lightly raised.
Alas, not obtaining refinement—
can one take it? Not obtaining distinction—
how can one plan?

Moreover, being is the vessel of earth, metal, and primordial yellow.
Its vessel, receiving fire, expands—
then sets forth to summon responses.
At first, as if present, as if absent,
if present, then misty and faint,
the Dao hidden in the subtle and obscure.
Subtle, then stirred by misty vapors;
obscure, then moved by swirling clouds.
Subtle and obscure stir and move,
misty vapors and swirling clouds—bellows and pistons.
At the beginning, the foundation is laid,
omens already sprout—
the Great Yin transforms and gives birth.
Transformation is spirit’s movement,
spirit’s movement is qi’s transformation.
Congealing and accumulating form substance.
Substance, deep blue—
rosy fire flows with light.
Light’s essence condenses,
essence’s redness penetrates the po.
Red shadow arrives at dawn,
condensing into jade’s rosy clouds—
called Li’s red flakes.
Li’s red flies,
light red soars,
divine beings take flight,
five colors soaring—
soaring five colors,
the Great Yang’s azure light.

chunks.original_text: 黄白黑黄，黄居中央，君父太阳，太阳黄道，黄道转北，黑道回还，黄道回还，回黄应律，律吕相生。 冬至一阳，曰何太短？ 夜何太长？ 月四夜，九阴胜其阳，阳生未复，晷景滋生时计月时至日生冬至极冬至极九日之中进一刻，五九五刻进则终，四十五日立春功。 立春之后得九日，九日之中进一刻，五九五刻进则终，四十五日春分同。 春分之后得九日，九日之中进一刻，五九五刻进则终，四十五日立夏同。 立夏之后又九日，九十之中进一刻，五九五刻进则终，四十五日四节同。 立夏至日中六十刻，一刻昼景渐长，日南极，夏至后退得九日，九日之中退一刻，五九五刻退则终，四十五日立秋功。 立秋之后得九日，九日之中退一刻，五九五刻退则终，四十五日秋分同。 秋分之后得九日，九日之中退一刻，五九五刻退则终，四十五日立冬同。 立冬之后得九日，九日之中退一刻，五九五刻退则终，四十五日八节终。 八节三百六十日，昼夜三万六千刻，三万六千时计刻。 时讦刻，冬至日中四十刻，日景捡梭如电激，太阳疾速不停光，自然阳气索灭藏。 阳藏阴用无休息，阴生阳长六十刻，阳终气升阳光出。 九华明，九华光裹翠华青，翠华神所尊光明。 尊明神黄，神升明堂，神称帝皇，帝皇传赤，赤帝度色，青帝受德，白帝生光，黑帝玄黄。 五帝混合，混合神光，神光郁郁，神用无极。 神极受正，正其神色，神藏其室，神黄神黑，黄黑神精。 黄者金神，黑者北灵，黑者水基，内怀其精。 其精甚灵，其精甚坚。 太上日：其精甚真，其中有信，信无不应。 信应者，天符也。 天符照明，飞符恍灵，灵运潜应，应神紫灵。 紫灵神药，药有神灵，神药灵灵，化元之英。 神与气精，神升紫云，其气运转，甲丙庚壬。 庚壬乃金水相盈，甲丙是水火滋荣，二火成炎，二木成林，火木眷恋，姊妹弟兄。 坎离震兑，男女相亲，男冠少阳，女笄少阴，阴阳合度，七八之数。 七八数讫，九六相得，晦朔弦望，四者三十。 九六之数，老阳乾父，老阴坤母，因母致亲。 比夫人伦，父之制子，子之制孙，生生相续，亲之又亲。 铅汞相亲，无异人伦，阴阳交合，纯粹之精。 灵续其景，景续其灵，景灵宫裹，虎啸龙昤，五音互奏、六律阳明，阳明神光，照耀明堂。 明堂正德，君臣相得，施仁设义，讲武修文。 忠信礼智，五常和平，皇化天下，富国安民。 诸辰经历，神气满室，五气交并，神降奔突。 气如烟雾，交合神御，交合之道，顺其气序。 气序无差，昏明寒暑，昼暑夜寒，阳流阴注。 广寒宫结水昌砂，砂结玲珑若马牙，马牙本是金乌骨，赫赫日精归月窟。 月窟日照白明堂，明堂便是金水室。 金水互相生，金润生黄液，液生鼎沸，汞流神水，瀑涌三三，重迭累累，凝如坚冰。 龙蟠虎视，虎性龙情，随光逐明。 光中恍惚，明中杳冥，丹砂灵英，灵英之质，生於神明。 阴神阳明，积阳以阴，阴以神之，阳以明之，阴阳合度，化育之基。 化者谓日有三照，育者谓月有三移，日月合气，二气相推。 水一火二，合而成三，三生万物，三变至极。 三者汞也，汞变生灵，灵英独秀，异宝奇珍，五行神物，药就希夷。 人问术士，必不能窥，唯有志者，怀而待时，得真五行之妙用，假凡五行之水火，五行生克，其理自然。
chunks.translated_text:
Yellow, white, black, and yellow—
yellow resides at the center,
the sovereign father, the Great Yang.
The Great Yang’s yellow Dao,
the yellow Dao turns north,
the black Dao returns in cycle,
the yellow Dao returns in cycle,
the returning yellow aligns with the pitch-pipes,
pitch and pipe mutually engender.

At winter solstice, the one Yang—
why is the day so short?
Why is the night so long?
For four nights,
the nine Yins overpower its Yang.
The Yang, though born, has not yet recovered;
the shadow’s length grows with the hour,
the time measured by the moon’s passage,
the day’s birth at winter solstice’s extreme.
Within nine days of winter solstice’s extreme,
the shadow advances by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* advanced, then complete—
forty-five days mark the onset of spring.

After the onset of spring, nine days pass,
within those nine days, the shadow advances by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* advanced, then complete—
forty-five days align with the spring equinox.
After the spring equinox, nine days pass,
within those nine days, the shadow advances by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* advanced, then complete—
forty-five days mark the onset of summer.

After the onset of summer, another nine days,
within those ninety days, the shadow advances by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* advanced, then complete—
forty-five days mark the four seasonal nodes alike.
From the onset of summer to the day’s center, sixty *ke*—
each *ke* sees the day’s shadow gradually lengthen.
The sun reaches its southern extreme;
after the summer solstice, nine days retreat,
within those nine days, the shadow retreats by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* retreated, then complete—
forty-five days mark the onset of autumn.

After the onset of autumn, nine days pass,
within those nine days, the shadow retreats by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* retreated, then complete—
forty-five days align with the autumn equinox.
After the autumn equinox, nine days pass,
within those nine days, the shadow retreats by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* retreated, then complete—
forty-five days mark the onset of winter.
After the onset of winter, nine days pass,
within those nine days, the shadow retreats by one *ke*;
five nines, five *ke* retreated, then complete—
the eight nodes conclude in forty-five days.

The eight nodes span three hundred sixty days,
day and night total thirty-six thousand *ke*,
thirty-six thousand *ke* of hourly reckoning.
At the hour’s reckoning, the *ke*—
at winter solstice’s midday, forty *ke*,
the day’s shadow swift as lightning’s flash,
the Great Yang’s rapid speed, its light unceasing.
Naturally, the Yang’s qi seeks concealment and storage.
Yang concealed, Yin employed without rest;
Yin born, Yang grown—sixty *ke*.
Yang’s end, qi ascends, Yang’s light emerges.

Ninefold radiance bright,
ninefold light enfolds jade-green radiance,
jade-green radiance—the divine’s revered luminosity.
Revered luminous divine yellow,
the divine ascends the Hall of Light,
the divine is called emperor-king.
The emperor-king transmits the red,
the Red Emperor bestows color,
the Azure Emperor receives virtue,
the White Emperor engenders light,
the Black Emperor’s profound yellow.
The Five Emperors blend as one,
blended divine light,
divine light lush and luxuriant,
divine power boundless.

The divine’s extremity receives rectitude,
rectifies its divine color.
The divine conceals within its chamber,
divine yellow, divine black—
yellow-black divine essence.
Yellow is the Metal Spirit,
black is the Northern Numen.
Black is water’s foundation,
inwardly cherishing its essence.
Its essence most numinous,
its essence most steadfast.

The Supreme declares:
Its essence most true,
within it lies trust—
trust that responds without fail.
That which responds to trust
is Heaven’s tally.
Heaven’s tally shines bright,
flying tally wondrously numinous.
Numinous movement subtly responds,
responding to the divine’s purple numen.
Purple numinous divine medicine,
medicine possessed of divine numinosity.
Divine medicine, numinous and spirited,
the flower of the primordial origin.

Spirit with qi and essence,
spirit ascends purple clouds,
its qi circulates and turns—
*Jia*, *Bing*, *Geng*, *Ren*.
*Geng* and *Ren* are Metal and Water in mutual fullness,
*Jia* and *Bing* are Water and Fire in flourishing abundance.
Two Fires form flame,
two Woods form forest.
Fire and Wood, bound in kinship,
sisters and brothers.
*Kan* and *Li*, *Zhen* and *Dui*—
male and female in mutual intimacy.
The male crowned with Lesser Yang,
the female coiffed with Lesser Yin.
Yin and Yang harmonize in measure,
the numbers seven and eight.

Seven and eight’s numbers complete,
nine and six mutually attain.
New moon, full moon, first quarter, last quarter—
these four span thirty days.
The numbers nine and six—
old Yang, the *Qian* father,
old Yin, the *Kun* mother,
through the mother, kinship is achieved.
Comparable to human relations,
the father governs the son,
the son governs the grandson,
generation upon generation,
kinship ever deepening.
Lead and mercury in mutual intimacy,
no different from human relations.
Yin and Yang in union,
the essence of purity.

The numinous continues its radiance,
radiance continues the numinous.
Within the radiance-numinous palace,
the tiger’s roar, the dragon’s song,
the five tones harmonize,
the six pitch-pipes’ Yang brightness.
Yang-bright divine light
illumines the Hall of Light.
The Hall of Light’s rectified virtue,
ruler and minister in harmony,
enacting benevolence, establishing righteousness,
practicing martial arts, cultivating letters.
Loyalty, trust, ritual, wisdom—
the five constants in peace.
The imperial transformation spreads beneath heaven,
enriching the state, pacifying the people.

The various celestial bodies traverse their courses,
divine qi fills the chamber.
The five qi intermingle,
the divine descends in a rushing torrent.
Qi like mist and haze,
intertwining with the divine’s governance.
The Dao of intertwining
follows the sequence of qi.
The sequence of qi without error—
dusk and dawn, cold and heat,
day’s heat, night’s cold,
Yang’s flow, Yin’s infusion.

The Palace of Vast Cold congeals water’s flourishing cinnabar,
cinnabar crystallizes, delicate as horse’s teeth.
Horse’s teeth are originally the Golden Crow’s bones,
the sun’s resplendent essence returns to the moon’s grotto.
The moon’s grotto, sunlit, becomes the white Hall of Light—
the Hall of Light is the chamber of Metal and Water.
Metal and Water mutually engender,
Metal’s moisture engenders yellow liquid.
Liquid boils in the crucible,
mercury flows as divine water,
cascading in threes,
layer upon layer,
congealing firm as solid ice.

The dragon coils, the tiger gazes,
the tiger’s nature, the dragon’s sentiment,
pursuing light, chasing brightness.
Within light, indistinct and vague;
within brightness, deep and obscure.
Cinnabar’s numinous flower,
the flower’s essence—
born of divine luminosity.
Yin’s spirit, Yang’s brightness,
accumulating Yang with Yin,
Yin with the spirit’s governance,
Yang with brightness’s governance.
Yin and Yang harmonize in measure—
the foundation of transformation and nurturance.

Transformation refers to the sun’s triple illumination,
nurturance refers to the moon’s triple movement.
Sun and moon unite their qi,
the two qi mutually propel.
Water as one, Fire as two—
united, they form three.
Three gives birth to the myriad things,
three’s transformations reach their extremity.

Three is mercury,
mercury’s transformation engenders the numinous.
The numinous flower stands alone,
a rare treasure, wondrous gem,
the five phases’ divine substance—
the medicine completed in the subtle and obscure.
If one questions the adept,
they surely cannot glimpse it.
Only those with resolve,
cherishing it, await the hour.
Attaining the true five phases’ wondrous use,
borrowing the ordinary five phases’ Water and Fire.
The five phases’ mutual generation and conquest—
such is the principle of nature.

Congealing and accumulating form substance.
Substance, deep blue—

chunks.original_text: 圣人神而明之，以知天地之化，不过曲成万物，通乎昼夜之道。 昼视晷度，准则天符，夜听更漏，上督河图。 月纪低勖，星稀南北，虚张下应於鼎中，神龟随火而奔逐，黑虎浮束白虎穴，赤龙跳入青龙窟，二药还元复混融，丹砂合体入金公。 汞与铅合，砂与金亲，金作神室，明堂正德，恍朗玄官，乾坤合同。 坤生震龙，阳符复行，离魂入魄，运转天呈。 水激火发鼎釜俱呜，阴阳运转，震受庚辛。 金本克木，夫何以生？ 月行丁位，金入火乡，火盛消金，金代木荣，火灭为土，土能生金，金能生水，水能生木，相克相生，互为父母。 父母生子，子继父母，坤生震兑，兑生坤体，三五气足，三光合度。 兔魄生光，月满束方，月满复亏，阴台已前。 十六受统，阴符复行，艮直丙南，二十有三，三五候足，金入水乡。 坤符荡荡，水归北方，凝而成金，化而为水。 火随爻动，象逐人生，出没神炉，明藏偃月。 长养金胎，化生金液，凝如黄酥，碎如金粟。 金色透明，从黄返赤，照缙火生，而成还丹。 开炉倒鼎，进出霞光，金砂如粉，研细如霜，和匀搏栩，搏摄阴阳。 九成黍粒，谢天祭毕，万斛明珠，难换一粒。 一粒才服，身生羽翼，呼风召雷，万神侍侧。 更换四时，留连日月，冬变炎暑，夏飞霜雪，秋发春华，春飘黄叶。 所谓宇宙在乎手，万化生乎身者也。 长河化酥酪，点金过北斗，吾不敢虚说，识取无中有，无中生天地，我同天地久。 其道至禁，诀之在口，妄示凡，必遭殃咎。 慎密修持，神明护佑流，广施阴德，神仙必有。 许真君石函记卷下竟

The sage, numinous and enlightened, comprehends the transformations of Heaven and Earth—nothing more than the bending to complete the myriad things, penetrating the Dao of day and night. By day, he observes the sundial’s degrees, aligning with the celestial tally; by night, he listens to the water clock’s chimes, overseeing the *River Chart*. The moon’s phases trace their course, stars sparse in north and south; the void’s expanse below responds within the crucible. The spirit-turtle chases the fire’s pursuit, the Black Tiger floats to the White Tiger’s den, the Red Dragon leaps into the Green Dragon’s cave. The two medicines return to their origin, merging once more; cinnabar unites with Metal Elder. Mercury joins with lead, cinnabar befriends gold. Gold becomes the spirit-chamber, the Hall of Light’s true virtue; radiant and vast, the Mysterious Palace, where Qian and Kun unite as one.

Kun gives birth to Zhen’s Dragon, the Yang tally resumes its course; the Li soul enters the Po, revolving with Heaven’s display. Water spurs fire, the crucible and cauldron both resound; yin and yang revolve, Zhen receives geng and xin. Metal inherently conquers Wood—how then does it engender? The moon moves to ding’s position, Metal enters the Fire’s realm. Fire’s exuberance melts Metal, Metal supplants Wood’s flourishing; Fire extinguished becomes Earth, Earth can generate Metal, Metal can generate Water, Water can generate Wood. Conquering and engendering, they become each other’s parents. Parents beget the child, the child succeeds the parents. Kun gives birth to Zhen and Dui, Dui gives birth to Kun’s body. When the three and five qi are full, the Three Luminaries align. The Hare’s spirit generates light, the moon waxes in the east; the moon waxes then wanes, before the Yin Terrace. Sixteen govern the tally, the Yin tally resumes its course. Gen points to bing in the south; on the twenty-third day, when the three and five periods are complete, Metal enters the Water’s realm. Kun’s tally flows vast, Water returns to the north, congealing into Metal, transforming into Water.

Fire follows the moving lines, images follow man’s life—emerging and vanishing in the spirit-furnace, hidden in the recumbent moon. Nurturing the Metal embryo, transforming to generate Metal liquid, congealing like yellow butter, crumbling like golden grains. The Metal’s hue becomes translucent, shifting from yellow to red; illuminating the silk-wrapped fire, it becomes the Reverted Elixir. Opening the furnace, overturning the crucible, radiant clouds pour forth. Golden cinnabar like powder, ground fine as frost, blended and kneaded, molding yin and yang. Ninefold refined millet grains—offerings to Heaven complete—a myriad bushels of luminous pearls cannot exchange for a single grain. One grain ingested, the body sprouts wings; summoning wind and calling thunder, the ten thousand spirits attend at one’s side. Altering the four seasons, lingering with sun and moon, winter transforms to scorching summer, summer flies with frost and snow; autumn blooms with spring’s blossoms, spring scatters yellow leaves.

This is what is meant by "the cosmos in the palm of one’s hand, the ten thousand transformations born from one’s body." The Long River turns to curds, transmuting gold beyond the Northern Dipper. I dare not speak falsely—discern the existence within nothingness. From nothingness, Heaven and Earth are born; I endure as long as Heaven and Earth. This Dao is most forbidden; its secrets lie in the mouth. Revealed recklessly to the vulgar, calamity and blame will surely follow. Practice with utmost care and secrecy, and the divine spirits will protect and bless you. Cultivate abundant hidden virtue, and immortality will surely be yours.

*Record in the Stone Casket of Perfected Xu, Volume the Lower—End.*
